ETYMOLOGY: From Old French 'poupee' (doll), diminutive of 'poupe' from Latin 'pupa' (girl, doll).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A movable model of a person or animal, usually controlled by strings from above or by a hand inserted from below.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 由线或手控制的，模仿人或动物的小型模型；木偶。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The puppeteer made the puppet dance gracefully across the miniature stage.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 木偶师让木偶在微型舞台上优雅地跳舞。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person, group, or country whose actions are controlled by others; someone who is easily manipulated.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 被他人或他国操控的人或国家；傀儡。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many critics viewed the new leader as a mere puppet of the former dictator.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多评论家认为新领导人不过是前独裁者的一个傀儡。
